newsitem.title: USA: National Steel sells Iron Ore Co stake.
newsitem.headline: National Steel sells Iron Ore Co stake.

text.p: National Steel Corp on Tuesday said it completed the sale of its 21.7 percent minority equity interest in Iron Ore Co of Canada to North Ltd, an Australian mining and forestry group.

National received about $85 million from North in exchange for its shares and realized an after-tax gain of about $25 million, or $0.58 per share, it said. The company will post the gain in the second quarter ending June 30.
National will continue to purchase iron ore from Iron Ore Co under the terms of long-term contracts, the company said.
It intends to utilize the net proceeds from the sale to strengthen its balance sheet, it said.
As part of the same transaction, Bethlehem Steel Corp also sold to North Ltd its minority stake in Iron Ore Co, National Steel said. Bethlehem Steel said in January its stake was 37.57 percent.
National Steel shares rose 1/8 to 7-7/8 Tuesday.
